description: godoc: fix site for large displays

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

https://codereview.appspot.com/6643062/diff/1/doc/style.css
File doc/style.css (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/6643062/diff/1/doc/style.css#newcode153
doc/style.css:153: max-width: 1200px;
On 2012/10/10 22:09:18, skybrian1 wrote:
> Is this necessary? I'm wondering if we could just let the user decide.

I'm on the fence. Do you feel strongly? My initial stance was that the user should just size their browser however is most convenient for them.

On second thoughts, maybe that's right. I'll remove this.

https://codereview.appspot.com/6643062/diff/1/doc/style.css
File doc/style.css (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/6643062/diff/1/doc/style.css#newcode153
doc/style.css:153: max-width: 1200px;
Is this necessary? I'm wondering if we could just let the user decide.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, skybrian@google.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.
Seems fine. However, if you want me to test this, I'll have to do it later.

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=75c634bee1e5 ***

godoc: fix site for large displays

R=golang-dev, skybrian
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6643062

On 11 October 2012 09:14,  <skybrian@google.com> wrote:
> Seems fine. However, if you want me to test this, I'll have to do it
> later.

No, that's ok. I have tested it.

subject: code review 6643062: godoc: fix site for large displays
